item.title: All NASA News - NASA
item.description: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

item.title: NASA Media Contacts - NASA
item.description: Media Contacts Roxana Bardan Mars Sample Return 771-200-7217 Gerelle Dodson NASA Workforce, STEM Engagement 202-358-1600 Jennifer Dooren Deputy News Chief,

item.title: NASA News
item.description: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

item.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
item.description: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

item.title: Cygnus XL Cargo Craft Installed on Station's Unity Module - NASA
item.description: Northrop Grumman’s new Cygnus XL spacecraft has been installed to the International Space Station. The mission is known as NASA’s Northrop Grumman Commercial Resupply Services 23, or Northrop Grumman CRS-23.

item.title: Robotic Arm Maneuvering Cygnus for Station Installation - NASA
item.description: At 7:24 a.m. EDT, NASA astronaut Jonny Kim, with NASA astronaut Zena Cardman acting as backup, captured the Cygnus XL spacecraft using the International Space Station’s Canadarm2 robotic arm.

item.title: NASA’s Deep Space Communications Demo Exceeds Project Expectations
item.description: The project has exceeded all of its technical goals after two years, setting up the foundations of high-speed communications for NASA’s future human missions to Mars.

item.title: NASA’s Tally of Planets Outside Our Solar System Reaches 6,000
item.description: The milestone highlights the accelerating rate of discoveries, just over three decades since the first exoplanets were found.

item.title: NASA Analysis Shows Sun’s Activity Ramping Up
item.description: It looked like the Sun was heading toward a historic lull in activity. That trend flipped in 2008, according to new research.

item.title: NASA’s GUARDIAN Tsunami Detection Tech Catches Wave in Real Time
item.description: A massive earthquake and subsequent tsunami off Russia in late July tested an experimental detection system that had deployed a critical component just the day before.

item.title: New U.S.-European Sea Level Satellite Will Help Safeguard Ships at Sea
item.description: Sea surface height data from the Sentinel-6B satellite, led by NASA and ESA, will help with the development of marine weather forecasts, alerting ships to possible dangers.

item.title: NASA Says Mars Rover Discovered Potential Biosignature Last Year
item.description: After a year’s worth of scientific scrutiny, the ‘Sapphire Canyon’ rock sample remains the mission’s best candidate for containing signs of ancient microbial life processes.

item.title: NASA to Share Details of New Perseverance Mars Rover Finding
item.description: A news conference this morning will focus on the analysis of a rock sampled by the agency’s Perseverance Mars rover last year, which is the subject of a forthcoming science paper.

item.title: NASA Study: Celestial ‘Accident’ Sheds Light on Jupiter, Saturn Riddle
item.description: An unusual cosmic object is helping scientists better understand the chemistry hidden deep in Jupiter and Saturn’s atmospheres — and potentially those of exoplanets.

item.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
item.description: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.

item.description: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, the leading center for robotic exploration of the solar system.

item.title: Submit a Media Inquiry | Blue Origin
item.description: If you’re a member of the press, please contact us at media@blueorigin.com with your inquiry and deadline.

item.title: Gallery | Blue Origin
item.description: Images available for download. Please credit Blue Origin.

item.title: Blue Origin Completes 35th New Shepard Mission | Blue Origin
item.description: Blue Origin successfully completed its 35th New Shepard flight and 15th payload mission today from Launch Site One in West Texas.

item.title: Blue Alchemist Hits Major Milestone Toward Permanent and Sustainable Lunar Infrastructure | Blue Origin
item.description: Blue Origin's pioneering in-space resource utilization system, Blue Alchemist, has successfully completed its Critical Design Review, marking a transformative milestone toward humanity's permanent expansion beyond Earth.

item.title: The Mission: Blue Origin’s Mars Telecommunications Orbiter | Blue Origin
item.description: Built upon our existing and affordable Blue Ring platform, our Mars Telecommunications Orbiter is ready to support NASA’s Mars mission in 2028.

item.title: Blue Origin’s New Shepard Completes 34th Mission to Space | Blue Origin
item.description: Blue Origin successfully completed its 14th human spaceflight and the 34th flight for the New Shepard program.
